p: The inhibitory potency against furin could be further enhanced with poly-arginine derivatives, found by a positional scanning of combinatorial l- and d-hexapeptide libraries (Cameron et al. 2000). Hexa- d-arginine ( 39, Table 11.1) inhibits furin and PC5 with K i values around 200 nM in the same range, whereas it is less active against PC1 and PC7. The elongated analogue nona- d-arginine-amide (D9R-amide, compound 40, Table 11.1) possesses a significantly improved inhibition constant of 1.3Â nM. In contrast to the analogous l-peptide, which was cleaved by furin, the d-configured D9R-amide was found to be fully stable (Cameron et al. 2000; Kacprzak et al. 2004).
